meanings.definition: arrogators: those who arrogate or claim without justification
meanings.sent1: The arrogant arrogators believed they were entitled to everything.
meanings.sent2: The community was tired of the selfish arrogators always taking credit for others' work.
meanings.sent3: The group of arrogators tried to claim the last piece of cake as their own.
meanings.sent4: The arrogators in the office were like seagulls fighting over a scrap of food.
meanings.sent5: The image of the arrogators pushing their way to the front of the line stuck in my mind.

meanings.definition: arrogators: the act of arrogating or claiming without justification
meanings.sent1: The constant arrogators of praise made it hard for others to be recognized.
meanings.sent2: The arrogators of power often faced resistance from those who valued fairness.
meanings.sent3: The comedy skit humorously portrayed the absurdity of the arrogators trying to take over the world.
meanings.sent4: The concept of time as an arrogators of moments slipping away felt strangely poetic.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted the arrogators of light, casting shadows in all directions.
